item.title: Andrea add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Let us destroy, but don't let us pretend that we are commiting an act of virtue." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I think God, in creating man, somewhat overestimated his ability." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Everything in the world is about sex except sex. Sex is about power." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Experience is merely the name men gave to their mistakes." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything, and the value of nothing." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I can resist anything except temptation." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If you want to tell people the truth, make them laugh, otherwise they'll kill you." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To lose one parent may be regarded as a misfortune; to lose both looks like carelessness." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "No good deed goes unpunished." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Every woman is a rebel." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Selfishness is not living as one wishes to live, it is asking others to live as one wishes to live." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The suspense is terrible. I hope it will last." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Francine Pascal
item.description: "He slowed down a bit more. "Gaia, how do you know these things?" She shrugged. "I'm smart." "And modest, too." "Modesty is a waste of time," she pronounced. "I'll keep that in mind." -- Francine Pascal

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Kenneth Grahame
item.description: "Believe me, my young friend, there is nothing - absolutely nothing - half so much worth doing as simply messing about in boats." -- Kenneth Grahame

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Kenneth Grahame
item.description: "Spring was moving in the air above and in the earth below and around him, penetrating even his dark and lowly little house with its spirit of divine discontent and longing." -- Kenneth Grahame

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Kenneth Grahame
item.description: "It's a goodly life that you lead, friends; no doubt the best in the world, if only you are strong enough to lead it!' 'Yes, it's <i>the</i> life, the only life, to live,' responded the Water Rat dreamily, and without his usual whole-hearted conviction. 'I did not exactly say that,' the stranger replied cautiously, 'but no doubt it's the best. I've tried it, and I know. And because I've tried it - six months of it - and know it's the best, here I am, footsore and hungry, tramping away from it, tramping southward, following the old call, back to the old life, <i>the</i> life which is mine and which will not let me go." -- Kenneth Grahame

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Kenneth Grahame
item.description: "Onion sauce! Onion Sauce!" -- Kenneth Grahame

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Kenneth Grahame
item.description: "He saw clearly how plain and simple - how narrow, even - it all was; but clearly, too, how much it all meant to him, and the special value of some such anchorage in one's existence. He did not at all want to abandon the new life and its splendid spaces, to turn his back on sun and air and all they offered him and creep home and stay there; the upper world was all too strong, it called to him still, even down there, and he knew he must return to the larger stage. But it was good to think he had this to come back to, this place which was all his own, these things which were so glad to see him again and could always be counted upon for the same simple welcome." -- Kenneth Grahame

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Kenneth Grahame
item.description: "But Mole stood still a moment, held in thought. As one wakened suddenly from a beautiful dream, who struggles to recall it, but can recapture nothing but a dim sense of the beauty in it, the beauty! Till that, too, fades away in its turn, and the dreamer bitterly accepts the hard, cold waking and all its penalties." -- Kenneth Grahame

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Kenneth Grahame
item.description: "Nothing seems really to matter, that's the charm of it. Whether you get away, or whether you don't; whether you arrive at your destination or whether you reach somewhere else, or whether you never get anywhere at all, you're always busy, and you never do anything in particular; and when you've done it there's always something else to do, and you can do it if you like, but you'd much better not." -- Kenneth Grahame
